newsitem.title: USA: CME's New Zealand dlr, rand futures to trade May 7.
newsitem.headline: CME's New Zealand dlr, rand futures to trade May 7.

text.p: The Chicago Mercantile Exchange will launch New Zealand dollar and South African rand futures and options contracts on Wednesday, May 7, the CME said in a bulletin to members on Friday.

The exchange said the New Zealand dollar contracts will trade in the Australian dollar pit of the CME's International Monetary Market. Members of the exchange's Index and Options Market will be allowed to trade New Zealand dollar futures for their own accounts through December 12, 1999.
South African rand contracts were assigned by the board to trade in the Growth and Emerging Markets division. ((Derivatives desk 312-408-8750)) E-mail derivatives@reuters.com
